cultural_etiquette: Always circumambulate monasteries and stupas in a clockwise direction.
Ask for permission before taking photos of monks or inside prayer halls.
Plastic bags are strictly banned in Sikkim; carry a reusable water bottle.
important_tips: Carry sufficient cash; ATMs in Darjeeling/Gangtok often run out or have long lines.
Sikkim is a 'Green State' — do not litter or carry disposable plastic bottles.
Always negotiate taxi rates before starting the journey if not using shared cabs.

accommodation.booking_tip: Request a room on the upper floor for better mountain views.
accommodation.name: Hotel Dekeling
accommodation.why_this: Centrally located with heritage wooden interiors and great views of Kanchenjunga.

activities.description: A high-altitude zoo famous for breeding Red Pandas and Snow Leopards in naturalistic habitats. The adjacent Himalayan Mountaineering Institute displays Everest expedition gear.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Padmaja Naidu Himalayan Zoological Park, Darjeeling, West Bengal
activities.how_to_reach: Shared taxi from Chowk Bazaar — ₹30, 15 min
activities.local_secret: The museum inside HMI has the original equipment used by Tenzing Norgay on the 1953 Everest climb.
activities.tips: The ticket covers both the Zoo and the Mountaineering Institute.
activities.why_this_fits: Nature lovers will appreciate seeing rare high-altitude wildlife found nowhere else in India.

activities.description: Walk through the manicured tea bushes of Darjeeling's second oldest tea estate. Watch the processing of the world-famous 'Champagne of Teas'.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Happy Valley Tea Estate, Darjeeling, West Bengal
activities.how_to_reach: Walk from Chowrasta Mall — 1.2 km, 20 min
activities.local_secret: Visit the factory outlet for 'First Flush' tea which is significantly cheaper than in city shops.
activities.tips: Wear comfortable walking shoes as the paths can be steep and slippery.
activities.why_this_fits: The rolling green hills and misty air provide a quintessential romantic backdrop.

activities.description: A colonial-era landmark offering stunning views of the valley. Famous for its pastries, roast chicken, and old-world charm.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Glenary's, Nehru Road, Darjeeling, West Bengal
activities.local_secret: The basement pub has a more local vibe and often features talented local acoustic bands.
activities.tips: Try the apple pie and the Darjeeling tea pot.
activities.why_this_fits: Perfect for a romantic dinner with live music and a view of the twinkling town lights.

itinerary.afternoon_summary: Visit the Himalayan Mountaineering Institute and the Snow Leopard at the Zoo.
itinerary.daily_weather_tip: Misty and cool; carry a light windbreaker even if it looks sunny.
itinerary.evening_summary: Walk through the aromatic Happy Valley Tea Estate and end at Chowrasta Mall.
itinerary.morning_summary: Arrive in Darjeeling via a scenic shared cab ride from NJP station.
itinerary.notes: Shared taxi from NJP to Darjeeling costs approx ₹400 per seat.

accommodation.booking_tip: Check for off-season discounts on their website.
accommodation.name: Hotel Dekeling
accommodation.why_this: Consistent quality and proximity to the main market.

activities.description: Witness the sun rising over Mt. Kanchenjunga and Mt. Everest. The peaks change color from grey to purple to golden orange.
activities.how_to_reach: Shared Jeep from hotel — ₹300 per person, 45 min
activities.local_secret: Skip the crowded observatory tower; stand on the open road slightly below for a better, quieter view.
activities.tips: Book your jeep the night before through your hotel.
activities.why_this_fits: The most iconic romantic experience in the hills; nature at its most majestic.

activities.description: A spiral railway track where the Toy Train makes a 360-degree turn amidst a lush garden with a panoramic view of Darjeeling.
activities.how_to_reach: Included in the Tiger Hill jeep tour
activities.local_secret: There is a small local market at the entrance selling very cheap hand-knitted gloves.
activities.tips: Wait for the Toy Train to pass for the best photo opportunity.
activities.why_this_fits: Beautifully landscaped gardens perfect for nature photography.

activities.description: A tiny, family-run eatery famous for authentic Tibetan food like Thukpa and Momos.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Kunga Restaurant, Gandhi Road, Darjeeling, West Bengal
activities.local_secret: The 'Beef Gyathuk' or 'Veg Wanton Soup' are local favorites.
activities.tips: It's very small, so arrive early to avoid a 30-minute wait.
activities.why_this_fits: Budget-friendly, cozy, and serves the best comfort food in the hills.

itinerary.afternoon_summary: Peace Pagoda visit and a relaxed walk through the Japanese Temple.
itinerary.daily_weather_tip: Tiger Hill is freezing at 4 AM; wear heavy woolens and gloves.
itinerary.evening_summary: Shopping for woolens and local handicrafts at the Tibetan Refugee Self Help Centre.
itinerary.morning_summary: Watch the sunrise over the Himalayas at Tiger Hill followed by Batasia Loop.
itinerary.notes: Tiger Hill trip usually includes Batasia Loop and Ghoom Monastery.

accommodation.booking_tip: Book the 'Private Room with Balcony' for valley views.
accommodation.name: Zostel Gangtok
accommodation.why_this: Private rooms are romantic and budget-friendly with a great social vibe.

activities.description: A clean, smoke-free, and vehicle-free zone lined with shops, cafes, and benches. It feels like a European town square.
activities.local_secret: The 'Roll House' in a narrow lane off MG Marg serves the best veg rolls in Sikkim.
activities.tips: Sit on the benches and enjoy the flower beds; it's the heart of the city.
activities.why_this_fits: Relaxed pacing, perfect for a romantic evening stroll and people-watching.

activities.description: The best live music venue in the Northeast. Great food, drinks, and a vibrant atmosphere.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Cafe Live & Loud, Tibeti Road, Gangtok, Sikkim
activities.local_secret: Check their Facebook page for the band lineup; local rock bands here are world-class.
activities.why_this_fits: Experience Gangtok's modern, cool side with your partner.

itinerary.afternoon_summary: Check-in and explore the pedestrian-only MG Marg.
itinerary.daily_weather_tip: The drive to Gangtok is bumpy; take motion sickness pills if needed.
itinerary.evening_summary: Enjoy the cafe culture and live music at MG Marg.
itinerary.morning_summary: Scenic drive from Darjeeling to Gangtok along the Teesta River.
itinerary.notes: Shared taxi Darjeeling to Gangtok: ₹500 per seat.

accommodation.booking_tip: Use the Zostel app for a 5% discount.
accommodation.name: Zostel Gangtok
accommodation.why_this: Reliable, clean, and has a great rooftop cafe.

activities.description: A glacial lake that remains frozen in winter. Surrounded by steep mountains and yaks, it's a site of immense natural beauty.
activities.local_secret: Rent a pair of gumboots at the lake for ₹50 to walk on the snow/slush comfortably.
activities.tips: Carry heavy woolens. Permits must be arranged 24 hours in advance.
activities.why_this_fits: High-altitude nature at its best. The lake's reflection is stunning for photos.

activities.description: A greenhouse showcasing Sikkim’s famous orchids and seasonal tropical flowers.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Flower Exhibition Centre, Ridge Park, Gangtok, Sikkim
activities.local_secret: The Ridge Park outside is great for a quiet sit-down away from MG Marg noise.
activities.tips: Best visited during the spring (March-May) or autumn (Oct-Nov).
activities.why_this_fits: Romantic walk through exotic blooms; very peaceful.

activities.description: Authentic Sikkimese and Nepali cuisine in a beautifully decorated traditional setting.
activities.local_secret: Ask for 'Chhurpi' (local cheese) based dishes for a unique taste.
activities.tips: Try the 'Jhol Momo' — momos in a spicy sesame soup.
activities.why_this_fits: A cultural culinary experience. Try the 'Thali' to taste multiple local dishes.

itinerary.afternoon_summary: Return to Gangtok and visit the Flower Exhibition Centre.
itinerary.daily_weather_tip: Tsomgo Lake is at 12,400ft. Oxygen is thin; move slowly and stay hydrated.
itinerary.morning_summary: Excursion to the sacred Tsomgo Lake and Baba Mandir.
itinerary.notes: Tsomgo Lake trip is weather-dependent. Always have a backup plan.

activities.description: A 200-year-old monastery belonging to the Nyingma order, offering a serene atmosphere and views of Gangtok town.
activities.local_secret: The murals inside are exceptionally detailed; look for the 'Wheel of Life'.
activities.tips: Visit during morning prayers (around 9 AM) to hear the monks chanting.
activities.why_this_fits: Spiritual and quiet, providing a moment of reflection before leaving the hills.

activities.description: One of the most important stupas in Sikkim, surrounded by 108 prayer wheels.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Do Drul Chorten Stupa, Gangtok, Sikkim
activities.local_secret: The Namgyal Institute of Tibetology is right next door; visit for ancient manuscripts.
activities.tips: Spin the prayer wheels in a clockwise direction only.
activities.why_this_fits: The sight of hundreds of prayer wheels turning is mesmerizing and peaceful.

itinerary.afternoon_summary: Last minute souvenir shopping and departure for NJP station.
itinerary.daily_weather_tip: Check for road blocks on the way to NJP if it's raining.
itinerary.evening_summary: Board the overnight train back to Kolkata.
itinerary.morning_summary: Visit Enchey Monastery and Do Drul Chorten Stupa.
itinerary.notes: Shared taxi Gangtok to NJP: ₹500. Train NJP to Kolkata: ₹1200 (3AC).

money_saving_hacks: Use shared taxis (Sumos) instead of private ones to save up to ₹3000 per trip.
Eat at local 'Bhojanalayas' for a ₹150 thali instead of tourist cafes.
Walk within Darjeeling and Gangtok; most attractions are within 2km of the center.
overall_vibe: You will wake up to the sight of Kanchenjunga glowing in the first light of dawn. This journey blends the colonial charm of tea gardens with the spiritual serenity of Sikkimese monasteries, offering a perfect budget-friendly escape into the clouds.
packing_tips: Layered clothing (t-shirts, fleece, and a heavy jacket).
Comfortable walking shoes with good grip.
Sunscreen and lip balm (high altitude sun is harsh).
Motion sickness medication for winding roads.
smart_insights: Book the 'Toy Train' Joy Ride weeks in advance as it sells out instantly.
Carry original ID proof and 4 passport photos for the Tsomgo Lake permit.
Shared taxis (Sumos) from NJP to Darjeeling/Gangtok are 80% cheaper than private cabs.

travel_between_cities.booking: Book on IRCTC 60 days in advance.
travel_between_cities.tips: Take a shared Sumo from NJP station exit for ₹400 to Darjeeling.

travel_between_cities.booking: Book at the Darjeeling Shared Taxi Stand (Chowk Bazaar).
travel_between_cities.tips: Sit on the left side of the car for the best views of the Teesta River.
